Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 05:11PM marie11 wrote: ouch, drains coming out.  all four came out today.  the side he did with lidocaine hurt way more than just pulling them out.  not the absolute relief i was hoping for, but better.  best thing i can find to wear for compression is ace wrap.  everything else digs too much.  remember do not sneeze.  back of right arm is numb.  does that mean its getting better or worse? i think my back hurts as much from just sitting around as from the surgery.  i hate sleeping in the middle of the day.  two hour nap after drains came out.  whats with that.   walking still is the only thing that feels good.  sitting or laying just feels bad after a while. have to remember not to take percocet before leaving for a walk.  get tired and dizzy 20 min later.  all i want to do is eat.  how much weight did you all gain while being couch potatoes?
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 08:10AM marie11 wrote: How can i be so tired from doing nothing?  its like 10:30 and i am ready for a nap.  will eat chocolate instead.  planning on heading out to walmart today.  problem as a mom is i am going for me.  bra and cookies, but the list gets exponentially long for the family.  think i can actually push a shopping cart.   pain and mobility are much better.  can manage to wash my own hair.  node bx site is by far the most painful still.  and pain is weird.  sometimes it hurts and sometimes it just doesnt.  unrelated to percocet.  i am a terrible patient and hate not feeling 100%.  spoke to surgeon yesterday.  all the final path is negative.  so nothing further needed.  well nothing more than months of fills and an exchange.  have a great day everyone.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2011 04:56AM marie11 wrote: This surgery thing sucks.  had b/l mast with sentinel node and expanders on wed.  dont get me wrong i am grateful to just be alive and watch the sunrise this morning.  still i want to complain about not being able to sleep well, the fine line between taking too much percocet and feeling dizzy and not enough and feeling too much pain.  i feel like the bride of frankenstein with all these drains hanging out of me.  slowing down though so maybe wont stay in for too long.  hemoglobin dropped from 12 to 9 so maybe that is part of the dizziness.  cant get the chloroprep off so skin stained yellow.  have caught drains on door knobs twice already.  think i would learn to be more careful after the first time.  worried about all the glitches from surgery.  skin flaps very thin-so worried about skin breakdown.  expanders feel too high-ps said he had to put them there cause my pec muscle was so thin.  i bench 80 pounds-how could they be too thin?  who would have thought that being thin and healthy would be a disadvantage here.  worried about falling platelets-there is a bad thing called HIT or heparin induced thrombocytopenia. it is an autoimmune reaction to heparin that causes you to form blood clots.  on the good news side sentinel node negative.  so once this is done i shouldnt need anything else.  mentally need to get out for a walk today.  ready to go now cause this is when i usually run.  think partner would kill me if i went while she is sleeping.  everyone have a great day and thanks for providing a place to rant.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2011 08:22AM marie11 wrote: i am not sure the pain will ever go away.  no matter what you all say.  the poking, digging, pinching, pulling whenever i move or take a deep breath.  drains are making less so maybe out soon.  but not by tomorrows ps apt.  i cannot imagine how much its gonna hurt when they do come out.  sentinal node side very sore.  cant put arm flat against my side.  must be swollen.  the only time things feel good is in the shower.  at least i can walk.  went for a mile and a half today.  feels so much more sane when i am out there than when i am just sitting here with nothing really to do. the food stuff is complicated and no one should beat themselves up about it.  it has become very hard to eat "healthy" and even when you think you are its not always good.  you would think potatoes are good right?  no not really unless organic.  i have mostly eaten an organic, macrobiotic diet very low in fat.  i have exercised for about an hour a day for my entire life.  i maintain my ideal body weight.  still it made no difference here.  i hope the lesson my kids learn isnt that you shouldnt worry about taking care of yourself cause it doesnt make a difference anyhow.  before this all happened i was starting to think about lowering our bpa levels.  i have a 1 year old daughter.  is there still bpa in the plastic water bottles? interesting about pictures on facebook.  i am not there partner keeps up for both of us, but hasnt posted anything about this.  but almost everyone who know me knows what is happening.  have apts scheduled months in advance had to rearrange entire schedule to take month off.  no one at hospital knew until i left by now hundreds more do.  neighbors know or will soon.  i live in a very tight suburb.  no one moves in or out.  and we all know everyones business.  for good and bad.  i am really a very private person.  but no way to do this in a quiet secret way.  too many drugs i guess just rambling on here.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2011 11:54AM marie11 wrote: driving not so bad.  shopping not as great.  why is everything i want too high for me to reach? and why do so many people want to get way too close.  bra shopping went well. seems to be better.  thanks for the advice.  someone should have reminded me not to open the back of the minivan. pain remains ever present.  sometimes less and sometimes more, but always just hurts.  is it gonna hurt like this until expanders come out?  my life is so boring i cant stand it.  catching up on everything, but still tiresome.  by the end of this all my kids pencils will be sharpened, and their legos sorted by size, shape and color.  dont know how much longer i can stay out of gym.  originally agreed to 2 weeks.  have a great day i have to get back to my filing.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 06:49PM marie11 wrote: shannon amazing what you went through with your leg.  that kind of thing and all ther others who have been through so much worse make me feel bad about my complaints.  not that it will stop me.  but it does change the perspective.  as i was slowly ambling along this moring i was both annoyed that all i can do is walk and extremely grateful that i have the ability to walk when so many cant.  have small collection that is getting slightly bigger but plastics guy doesnt want to drain it, yet.  cord in right arm still really tight but not getting any worse now.  i feel like snow white looking at breasts.  i have recently spent an inordinant amount of time looking at other womens breasts.   i never really noticed them before, but now am looking for the perfect pair.  hard to find.  they are too big, too small, too saggy, hard to find ones that look just right.  seems like everyone who gets reconstruction goes to a good sized c.  that would be huge for me.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2011 06:08PM marie11 wrote: have been busy and tired.  back to work and as i am finding out it was probably too soon.  although i asked both plastic surgeon and breast surgeon if a month would be long enough and they both said it would be ok.  my job involves more reaching for things than i remember.  if i could just take drugs at work i would be fine.  but that would not be cool.   Pain has improved a fair amount.  finally.  i still take the narcotics whenever i can.  when not working or driving.  but now its more just cause i like a break from the pain, not because i cant function with the pain.  have tried a bunch of other things and none really seem to work better.  lidocaine patches, valium, flexeril, and motrin.  the best thing is massage to release the scar tissue.  wonder if its more common in thin women, but it feels like my skin is just stuck to my sternum and ribs.  anyone else have trouble with this? i manaaged to run a whole mile today.  it finally felt good.  that helps a lot psychologically.  makes me feel like someday i might get my body back to normal. i am envious of maria being in the outer banks.  our family loves it there.  but couldnt make the trip this year.  hope you are having a great time.  have a great weekend everyone
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 05:07PM marie11 wrote: starting to feel a little more like a human being.  still in significant pain but would now stop short of calling it agony.  was crazy to go back to work full time a month after surgery.  but here i am working about 80 hours this week. funny to read about bra shopping.  i cant imagine anything ever touching my chest again.  it just feels umcomfortable.  gonna stay pretty small so may not need anything.  have in 110cc now and that seems almost as big as i was when i started this whole process.  seems more spead out.  ps thinks i will be happy with around 300.  its hard to imagine some of the numbers i see on here.  running is finally going better 2 miles today.  still not nearly enough to match the oreo consumption, but at least moving in the right direction.  enjoy vacation everyone.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2011 09:39AM marie11 wrote: feeling a lot better today.  but that makes the boredom worse.  have like 16 games of words with friends going.  losing most of them badly.  walking was good, but makes me more tired than i expect it should.  ps hasnt really put any restrictions on me.  we did agree that i wouldnt raise my heart rate for 2 weeks.  beyond that if it feels ok i can do it.  pounding the chocolate a lot harder than the protein.  i guess chocolate milkshakes count as protein.  all the vitamins seem to get lonely without food to accompany them.  vit a and chips, vit c and nuggets, vit d and wheat thins, vit e and ice cream, zinc and grapes.  chicago is a great city.  at least as a visitor.  shopping, eating and running there are all good.  we put home addition on the back burner with all this.  cant imagine packing and moving in 5 weeks.  good luck.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2011 08:21AM marie11 wrote: i fully expect to be pain free and with full range of motion now.  and completely off the pain meds.  maybe that is a bit ambitious for 10 days post op.  it does get better every day, but clearly not fast enough for me.  walked 4 miles this morning.  the shuffling old people pass me by like race walkers.  walking is the only time that my body doesnt just hurt.  if it wasnt so hot out i would prob walk 20 miles today.  but since it is i will be resigned to my house arrest and keep filing (think its time to part with electric bills from the 90's), organizing the tupperware, teaching myself calculus and eating.  if i am gonna be in trouble for the chocolate dont tell maria about the double stuffed oreos. i could go shopping, but honestly dont even need anything.  i feel like the most boring person on the planet. have a great day everyone.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2011 11:53AM marie11 wrote: Neither my BS or PS put any restrictions on activity.   I took it pretty easy for two weeks cause I didn't want to cause any bleeding.  But since then I have been running and returning to regular activities.  I am up to a slow 3 mile run.   Do a ton of stretching and range of motion exercises. Basically have full range of motion, but still tight at times.  I thought swimming might help with some of the tightness and weights might help with some of the back pain.  Will try to start out easy and respect my bodies need for rest and recovery.  Gonna bet no one approves of my playing soccer and shooting baskets with the kids.  I am 6 weeks out from b/l mastectomy and expander placement.  I just want my life back.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 11:59AM marie11 wrote: I am new here and could benefit from your experience.  I am having a b/l mastectomy, sentinal node bx with expanders done next Wed.  I would like some information about what to expect in terms of physical recovery.  I am 47 and in very good shape.  Run between 6 and 12 miles a day.  Spin, bike, play soccer, weight lift as well.  I have been doing daily Pilate's chest work to try to loosen things up ahead of time.  PS has not recommended any physical therapy.  Will I need it?  How long before I can get back to running, swimming and lifting.  Or should I simply be asking the question how long before I can brush my teeth with out it hurting?
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2011 01:42AM marie11 wrote: drains are down to between 5 and 30 cc every 8 hours.  still not low enough to come out.  seeing ps on tues at least 2 will come out.  but that prob wont help much.  tried camisole thing on friday but it didnt feel as good as hospital bra.  maybe try again tomorrow cause this thing feels awful.  pain still not well controlled.  either dizzy or in pain.  hate both feelings.  but dizzy worse during day.  still cant really get comfortable at night.  but i guess over all getting better.  fewer overall complaints
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 09:40AM marie11 wrote: pain improving, ps is a sadist for not allowing motrin for 2 weeks.  i finally disobeyed him after 10 days and feeling much better now.  i think i could run now if only i could find something to hold the places that need holding without pinching the places that still hurt.  headed to the gym later today cant stand it any longer.  5 mile walk not cutting it.  have a cord under my arm which is limiting mobility and causing more pain.  thats not supposed to happen with sentinel node bx.  trying to find pt that knows about this is not so easy.  my patience to talking to uninformed people on the phone is very limited.  i dont really care if the pt site takes my insurance i care if they have someone who has seen this before and can help me.  cant imagine shopping for nipples.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2011 05:31PM marie11 wrote: I am impatient and want my life back. I have almost everything I asked for cancer free, full range of motion and full muscle strength. I am almost there, but right arm is still tight cant get it straight overhead. Still last week I couldnt get it past shoulder height so it is much better. I forgot to ask for pain free. That is still a big problem. I don't think I should still need narcotics a month later. But I do. Unfortunately I can't take them while working so then I am really in pain. So far no good answers about why so much pain or how to manage. Ps said no when I asked him to take out implants. I will never tell him this but it did feel slightly better when he filled them. Bs said you are doing great stop trying to do so much and it will get better. Best answer so far is from pt who says it's scar tissue and massage it five times a day. I spend the whole first mile of my morning walk/run rubbing my chest. Wonder what the neighbors think of that? It does help so i dont really care what they think. Nothing I do or dont do exercise wise seems to make it better or worse so I just do whatever doesnt hurt too much. Have been running 1/2 mile in 6 min. Used to run a mile in seven just a month ago. Peace to all and thanks for being here.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2011 03:30AM marie11 wrote: Ouch, ouch, ouch.  this is not "discomfort."  this just hurts.  the tissue expanders hurt constantly.  still on narcotics around the clock.  ps didnt even fill at all at placement because muscle was too thin.  i am ready to go see him on monday and tell him to forget the whole thing.  take out the expanders, revise the scar and let me get back to my life.  i absolutely hate who i have become now.  weak, tired, slow.  cant really workout.  cant go back to my job 100%.  have to ask co workers to cover for the things i am not gonna be able to do.  and no end in sight.  i cannot do this for months on end.  when we originally talked about expanders we said a couple of fills after surgery and then exchange.  whole process should have been done by end of august.  now it hasnt even started.  headed out for a walk cause it is the only thing i can do. sorry to be so negative.  just fed up.  hope the rest of you are having a better day, week, month.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 06:35PM marie11 wrote: Glad to hear folks are doing well. Vacation sounds good. Starting to feel somewhat better. Completely off narcotics. Finally. So now I wanna get back to the gym. I am mainly a runner but at the gym I like to swim, spin and lift. Any advice?
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight
